DeregistrationReasonOtherText: The gas tanks were removed from the property

_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Polish and Other Sanitation Good Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Planned Changes to Improve Safety:  

RMP and PSM are implemented at this plant because of its aerosol filling operation. We are actively engaged in closing this operation. Once closed, there will be no future need for the propane-butane mixture currently used as a propellant for aerosol products. Other un-involved operations at this plant will continue. The aerosol filling operation is actively being outsourced to other businesses. Currently, we are only operating the aerosol line about 2 weeks per month. It was our initial goal to close the process by year-end 2015, but delays in outsourcing may extend that date to April 2016. We foresee no delays in meeting our goal of ceasing operation of the aerosol filling process by April 2016 if not earlier. The equipment associated with the aerosol filling process will be removed from service and sold, scrapped or re-purposed.  



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies: 

This facility complies with NFPA-58 and Texas Railroad Commission LP-Gas Safety Rules. It is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local regulations for storage and use of these regulated substances.  For all incidents or situations requiring emergency response assistance, it is our policy to notify the City of Irving, TX Fire and Police Departments (911) for response to the emergency. We provide copies of our contingency plans to the local public safety departments and closest major hospital. 



Facility and the Regulated Substance Handled:  

This facility formulates and blends liquid and solid chemicals into maintenance and cleaning products for industry and other commercial and public institutions.  This facility is an industrial user of propane-butane mixture as a propellant for aerosol products.  This process consists of two 9,000-gallon propane-butane storage tanks with interconnecting piping, compressors, pumps and the associated aerosol filling, capping and packaging equipment.



General Accidental Rel

ease Prevention program:

This facility complies with the Chemical Accident Prevention Provisions rule (40 CFR part 68) and all applicable state and local codes and regulations.  The LP-Gas System is designed, installed and maintained in accordance with NFPA 58 and Texas Railroad Commission LP-Gas Safety Rules. 



Five-year Accident History:

We have never had an accident involving our LP-Gas system that caused any fatalities, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place.



Emergency Response Program:

In the event of an uncontrolled release involving our LP-Gas system, an Emergency Response Plan for this facility has been developed, implemented and coordinated with local agencies responsible for responding to accidental releases.
